newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: REED-ELSEVIER PLANS TO LAUNCH SCIENTIFIC DATABASE.
newsitem.headline: REED-ELSEVIER PLANS TO LAUNCH SCIENTIFIC DATABASE.

text.p: Anglo-Dutch publishing group Reed-Elsevier said on Friday it planned to launch a scientific database later this year.

Elsevier manager Fokko Covers said the group planned to start the on-line service, to be called Science-Direct, in the third quarter of 1997 and planned to make all 1,200 of its scientific journals available via the service within two years.

Covers said the service would also carry information provided by other scientific publishers and would be accessible by a direct online connection, via the Internet or through Reed Elsevier's legal and general information database Lexis/Nexis.

Covers said traditional "hard-copy" formats were still the most popular medium in scientific publishing and that the introduction of electronic media had proceeded more slowly in this sector than others in which Reed-Elsevier is active.
However, the easy-to-use browse and search facilities offered by the database might accelerate the introduction of electronic formats and eventually boost revenues, he said.
"In the long run this could generate extra revenues as subscribers start to look beyond the journals to which they already subscribe for information," he said.

Reed-Elsevier said in an end-of-year trading statement in December that it planned to accelerate its investment in electronic publishing but the statement did not mention specific plans for the scientific publishing sector.
